page.title: 20POLWARTH FAIR
page.content: THE ANCIENT POLWARTH FAIR WAS HELD AT THE TIME OF ST MUNGO'S FEAST DAY IN MID-JANUARY & WAS KNOWN CHIEFLY FOR FOOTWEAR. POLWARTH WAS A VILLAGE RENOWNED FOR ITS SOUTARS OR COBBLERS. IT MAY HAVE BEEN ON ONE OF THESE OCCASIONS THAT ONE OF THE PACKMEN WAS MURDERED ON THE SLOPING ROAD LEADING DOWN FROM THE VILLAGE TO THE CHURCH. IT IS KNOWN AS PACKMAN'S BRAE TO THIS DAY & THE SITE OF THE CRIME IS MARKED BY A STONE. IT MAY BY SAID THAT THERE IS CURRENTLY NO CRIME IN THE PARISH BUT THEN THERE ARE NOT SO MANY PEOPLE .
